title: Kim Jong Un Admits Past Failures, Promises Future Success
sub_head: North Korean leader, kicking off rare party-congress, vowed a new era of self-reliance
body:
SEOUL—North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, kicking off a rare party-congress meeting, acknowledged economic failures and promised a new era of self-reliance.
In what is the North’s biggest political event in years, Mr. Kim addressed thousands of congress members and other attendees on Tuesday, vowing to produce policies that bring national reunification, boost external relations and strengthen the ruling Workers’ Party.
As he had in August, Mr. Kim admitted defeat on the country’s economic plan for the five years ended in 2020.
“Almost all sectors fell a long way short of the set objectives,” he said, according to text of the remarks published by state media Wednesday. “The key to breaking through the existing manifold difficulties with utmost certainty and speed lies in consolidating our own strength, our internal force, in all respects.”
Mr. Kim didn’t outline policy specifics, though the Workers’ Party meeting is expected to continue for several days. He also didn’t mention the U.S. or President-elect Joe Biden, whose election Pyongyang hasn’t yet acknowledged.
